Usually I'll make the error text tell me what I expected.  So, 
something along the lines of:

assertTrue("Name field should be valid after entering correct first 
and last name", nameField.IsValid());

-Eric

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> 
wrote:
> Kevin Lawrence wrote:
> 
> > I find that the stack trace gives me plenty of information to 
understand
> > the failure and that more text is not necessarily better.
> 
> Yes. I prefer to let line numbers be my guide. When that's not 
enough, 
> however, ...
> 
> > Of course, if I can't find a way to make the test clearer, I'll 
add a
> > message to the assertion :-)
> 
> Exactly, and we have been talking about what that message should 
read.
